translation.en: And I'll start it up...
-...and we'll start generating. -[dial clicks]
John has a very special mission in life.
translation.ko: 존에겐 아주 특별한 일생의 사명이 있습니다

translation.en: He is trying to contact aliens.
It was started by myself. My grandfather helped me.
I lived with my grandparents in a small cottage in Northern Michigan.
translation.ko: 전 미시간 북부의 작은 시골집에서 조부모님과 함께 살았는데

translation.en: I started building the electronic equipment to make contact
with whatever might be out there beyond the Earth.
translation.ko: 지구 밖에 있을지도 모를 존재에 닿으려고요

translation.en: It grew to encompass an entire bedroom.
translation.ko: 장비가 침실 전체를 에워쌀 만큼 늘었는데

translation.en: That equipment continued to grow.
In the next two years, it was migrating into the living room.
It became more and more massive.
Most everything I did was self-taught.
I envisioned an idea and completed that vision,
built it into a physical reality.
I was always seeking to explore,
to look beyond what we have here.
translation.ko: 여기 우리가 가진 그 이상을 보려고요

translation.en: I pictured many alien worlds,
imagining what it would be like to make contact.
The moment of sharing extreme knowledge and thoughts
translation.ko: 극도의 지식과 생각을 공유하는 그 순간과

translation.en: and communication with another species,
is just beyond anything most of us even imagine.
translation.ko: 다른 종족과의 소통을 상상하는 건 우리 대부분의 상상력을 넘어선 거죠

translation.en: I seem to be picking up a radio signal.
Okay, fine.
[John] I decided that the best way to try and make contact
translation.ko: 교신에 가장 좋은 방법은 우주 공간으로

translation.en: was to broadcast a signal into outer space.
I thought the best signal would be music.
Technically, we were achieving the actual transmissions
translation.ko: 실제로 조부모님 댁 앞에 있던 큰 탑을 통해

translation.en: from a large tower out in front of my grandparents' home.
I sent music into space because it represents a certain, uh, universal language.
translation.ko: 음악을 우주로 보낸 건 음악이 보편적 언어를 나타내기 때문이죠

translation.en: And I'm talking about non-commercial music as such.
I'm talking about jazz, uh, electronic music...
translation.ko: 비상업적 음악 말이에요 예를 들면 재즈, 전자 음악, 크라프트베르크 탄제린 드림, 하모니아

translation.en: Kraftwerk, Tangerine Dream, Harmonia,
translation.ko: 재즈, 전자 음악, 크라프트베르크 탄제린 드림, 하모니아

translation.en: and there were many others.
African music,
Eastern music, which covers a broad area.
translation.ko: 동양 음악 등 광범위한 지역의 음악요

translation.en: Reggae, Afrobeat...
And one of the things I really liked to send out was gamelan music.
translation.ko: 제가 즐겨 전송했던 건 가믈란 음악이었어요

translation.en: It was a really beautiful form.
[reporter] John Shepherd has devoted all his time, money, and energies
translation.ko: 존 셰퍼드는 자신의 모든 시간과 돈과 에너지를

translation.en: to a personal search for outer space aliens.
[John on news report] I send cultural or creative music out into space.
translation.ko: 전 문화적이거나 창의적인 음악을 우주로 보냅니다

translation.en: I beam it out for approximately half a million, million miles out into space.
About twice the distance of the moon.
This is Project STRAT Earth Station One,
translation.ko: 여긴 스트랫 프로젝트 지구 제1 지국

translation.en: broadcasting to you from beautiful Northwestern Michigan.
You are listening to the group Harmonia.
This is Project STRAT Earth Station One signing off from another broadcast day.
translation.ko: 스트랫 프로젝트, 지구 제1 지국 오늘 방송을 종료합니다

translation.en: If you ETs are out there, we'd like you to tune in again tomorrow night at nine p.m.
translation.ko: 외계인 여러분께서는 내일 밤 9시에 주파수를 맞추시면

translation.en: for more cultural music. This is John Shepherd.
translation.ko: 음악을 더 청취하실 수 있습니다 저는 존 셰퍼드였습니다

translation.en: [John] I don't remember much about my mom.
Things were rough in the early years.
It wasn't the best home environment to raise me in.
My dad left while I was just born,
and my grandma felt sorry for me and took me with her.
translation.ko: 절 딱하게 여긴 조모님이 절 데려오셨죠

translation.en: I had very little contact with my mother.
She was always a little different than I was.
Almost... Not alien. That's not the right word, really.
translation.ko: 거의... 외계인은 아니고요 그건 적절한 단어가 아닌데

translation.en: Just different.
The fondest memories were after my grandparents adopted me.
translation.ko: 제일 좋은 추억은 조부모님들이 절 입양한 뒤예요

translation.en: Took care of me, raised me.
Sometimes taking the course that I have in my life and the path
translation.ko: 때로 제 인생의 경로와 그 여정을 가는 건

translation.en: is like a... maybe a lonely mountain road
translation.ko: 더 높은 곳으로 가는 외로운 산행 같아요

translation.en: to some higher elevation peaks, to see the view,
translation.ko: 더 높은 곳으로 가는 외로운 산행 같아요 정상으로 올라 경치를 보고

translation.en: to check out something most people don't see.
translation.ko: 대부분이 보지 못하는 걸 보고자 하는 거죠

translation.en: So, you tend to go it alone more.
You don't have much company in this.
[John] I set up this whole operation inside of a small cottage
translation.ko: 기기 전부를 작은 시골집 내부에 설치했는데 인구 밀도가 적은 지역 한복판이었어요

translation.en: in the middle of a kind of sparsely populated area.
Small town, you know, rural.
My lifestyle, relative to the local lifestyle,
translation.ko: 지역민들의 생활과 비교해 제 생활 방식은

translation.en: was quite, quite removed, quite different.
My mind was in space and in other realms,
translation.ko: 제 정신은 우주와 다른 영역에 있는데

translation.en: where my body was in this local community,
translation.ko: 제 육체는 이 지역 사회에 있었죠

translation.en: this little... real quiet, peaceful area.
translation.ko: 이 작고 조용하고 평화로운 시골 동네에요

translation.en: But my mind was traveling, traveling the cosmos.
translation.ko: 하지만 제 정신은 여행 중이었어요 우주를 여행했죠

translation.en: Uh, probably 12, 14 years old, I realized that I was a little different,
that I was gay.
Growing up gay in Michigan was rather difficult.
translation.ko: 미시간에서 동성애자로 자라는 건 꽤나 힘들었어요

translation.en: That's one of the tougher realities, and especially in a rural area.
translation.ko: 현실이 보다 힘들어지죠 특히 시골 지역에서는요

translation.en: You don't get as much, well, shall we say, understanding.
You don't get as much of that.
I think the real tough part to deal with sometimes is loneliness.
translation.ko: 진짜 힘든 부분은 때때로 외로움 같아요

translation.en: You don't go right out and, so to speak, date somebody for very long
translation.ko: 절 특이하다고 생각하지 않는 누군가를 만나

translation.en: that they don't find out you're a little different.
To find someone that is on the wavelength that I am on
and be able to share my life with that person in any degree or way
translation.ko: 그 사람과 제 삶을 공유하는 건 거의 불가능한 거 같아요

translation.en: is nearly impossible. Although I believe it exists.
translation.ko: 거의 불가능한 거 같아요 존재하리라 믿긴 하지만요 다들 자기 짝이 있다고 믿어요

translation.en: I believe for everybody there's someone.
translation.ko: 존재하리라 믿긴 하지만요 다들 자기 짝이 있다고 믿어요

translation.en: As time went on, the equipment got consuming most of the house.
translation.ko: 시간이 흐르면서 장비가 집의 대부분을 자치해서

translation.en: It became obvious that we needed more room.
My grandmother and I got together and pooled our funds to build an addition.
translation.ko: 전 할머니와 함께 돈을 모아 부속 건물을 지었어요

translation.en: It had plenty of room to expand.
The project could be fully realized.
[male reporter] John Shepherd calls his project "STRAT."
That's an acronym for Special Telemetry Research and Tracking.
There are 60,000 volts running through his basement,
powering a signal that's beamed straight out into space.
[John] So, I built this two-story-high deep-space transmitter, basically,
translation.ko: 이 2층 높이의... 심층 우주 송신기를 만들었어요 동조 회로 공명기죠

translation.en: a tuned circuit resonator.
translation.ko: 심층 우주 송신기를 만들었어요 동조 회로 공명기죠

translation.en: It allowed me to reach deeper and further out into space.
translation.ko: 덕분에 더 깊고 먼 우주까지 닿을 수 있습니다

translation.en: Project STRAT had become a major operation.
translation.ko: 스트랫 프로젝트는 제 주된 일이 되었어요

translation.en: I was busy developing other kinds of devices for communication.
translation.ko: 전 또 다른 종류의 통신 장치를 개발하느라 바빴어요

translation.en: I never gave up trying to make contact.
translation.ko: 전 교신 시도를 포기한 적 없습니다

translation.en: And the excitement, for me, was always there,
translation.ko: 제겐 늘 설렘이 있었죠 어떤 일이 일어날지 모른다는

translation.en: always the anticipation that something might happen.
translation.ko: 제겐 늘 설렘이 있었죠 어떤 일이 일어날지 모른다는 기대감이 늘 있었습니다

translation.en: We're now going to bring you some Afropop to warm up your evening.
translation.ko: 이제 아프로팝을 들으면서 이 저녁을 시작해보겠습니다

translation.en: [John] It was always an exploration. It was always a sort of a dream state.
So, I kept going. I kept doing that throughout... well, 25, 30 years of my life.
Can't say I found a lot of... hard data
translation.ko: UFO와 관련해 큰 의미를 지니는 확실한 데이터를

translation.en: that would be of great significance, necessarily, on the UFO front.
translation.ko: 큰 의미를 지니는 확실한 데이터를 많이 찾았다고는 말 못 하겠지만

translation.en: But as far as inspiration, creative ideas,
it gave me the chance to do all of that
translation.ko: 영감과 창의적 아이디어 측면에선 승승장구하며 다른 사람들과 그 결과를 공유할 기회를 얻었죠

translation.en: and to share the results with people, with others.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들과 그 결과를 공유할 기회를 얻었죠

translation.en: And it filled my life. It gave it something, meaning.
What remains of Project STRAT is what's stored in this building.
translation.ko: 스트랫 프로젝트의 남은 건 이 건물에 보관돼 있습니다

translation.en: A lot of the equipment is disassembled for storage,
but it's still here in its spirit, you might say.
translation.ko: 아직도 그 정신은 남아 있죠 말하자면요

translation.en: And this was... [blows] ...one of the data mapping consoles.
There were endless components, all kinds of unique things.
translation.ko: 부품이랑 온갖 독특한 것들이 끝도 없어요

translation.en: Satellite communication equipment,
high-power microwave tubes that used to transmit microwaves.
So, it's lots and lots of stuff that was all parts of the lab,
including the high-voltage transmitter accelerator
that we used for sending signals into space.
translation.ko: 우주로 신호를 보내는 데 썼던 거죠

translation.en: So, these are just the remnants, or little leftover pieces of thought.
translation.ko: 이게 그 흔적들입니다 혹은 생각의 잔재요

translation.en: Well, having had to give up, due to lack of funds,
was deeply frustrating, almost depressing.
But also realizing that maybe it was time to move on.
translation.ko: 하지만 정리할 때라는 걸 깨닫게 해줬어요

translation.en: I never really had any serious boyfriends
translation.ko: 진지했던 남자 친구나 꾸준하게 사귄 사람은

translation.en: or anyone that I went steady with, that sort of thing.
translation.ko: 진지했던 남자 친구나 꾸준하게 사귄 사람은 한 명도 없었는데 그러다 1993년에

translation.en: But in 1993,
I met somebody I really love very much named John Litrenta.
translation.ko: 정말 사랑하는 사람을 만났습니다 존 리트렌타죠

translation.en: We were both at a club one evening. That's where we met.
translation.ko: 어느 날 저녁 우린 둘 다 클럽에 갔었는데 거기서 만났어요

translation.en: When he first walked in the door of the club, I was still there...
translation.ko: 이이가 처음 클럽을 들어설 때 전 거기 있었는데

translation.en: I was quite... taken by his appearance.
His look... the fact that he was different.
There was an attraction almost immediately to the way he looked.
translation.ko: 그래서 겉모습에 거의 즉각적인 매력을 느꼈어요

translation.en: [John Shepherd] When I first met John, I had this impression that,
translation.ko: 존을 처음 만났을 때 그런 인상을 받았어요

translation.en: "This fellow's really kind of different. He gives me an interesting impression.
translation.ko: '이 친구는 진짜 좀 다르구나' 흥미로운 사람 같다고요

translation.en: I think I wanna meet this guy."
It just came over me to go ahead and get up the courage
to go over and say hello and introduce myself, at least.
translation.ko: 가서 인사하고 제 이름 정도는 말할 수 있었어요

translation.en: And after that, it just seemed like...
we were, well, we were off and running a bit, I'd say.
We started discussing music
and some of the more obscure things we love about music.
translation.ko: 음악 얘기를 시작했고 심오한 것들이나 음악을 사랑하는 이유를 얘기했죠

translation.en: John's character is really warm.
What I really like about him is that warmth and that understanding that he has.
translation.ko: 제가 정말 좋아하는 건 그의 따뜻함과 이해심이에요

translation.en: Once I met him and realized that he was that sort of person:
translation.ko: 이 사람을 만나자마자 어떤 사람인지 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: warm, loving, sensitive, patient.
I was like, "Wow, that's really... That's really something.
You don't find that every day."
And that's what everyone, I think, in this world to some degree seeks
translation.ko: 그게 바로 세상 모든 사람이 찾아 헤매지만

translation.en: and doesn't always find it.
I was one of the lucky ones.
I feel I found it. Found it in John.
translation.ko: 존을 만났을 때 전 그걸 찾았다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: So, contact has been made.
My interest is in finding out the unknown, and the unknown is just that, unknown.
translation.ko: 제 관심은 미지를 발견하는 거죠 미지는 알려지지 않았으니까요

translation.en: And you search, and you continue searching because of your desire,
translation.ko: 찾고 또 찾는 이유는 바라는 게 있고

translation.en: because of that you know there's something there.
